author: srdjant
title: GitHub comments used to distribute malware (BleepingComputer)
text:
GitHub comments used to distribute malware (BleepingComputer)
GitHub comments used to distribute malware (BleepingComputer)Posted Apr 25, 2024 19:52 UTC (Thu) by srdjant (guest, #171146)
In reply to:
[GitHub comments used to distribute malware (BleepingComputer)](/Articles/971051/)by rrolls
Parent article:
[GitHub comments used to distribute malware (BleepingComputer)](/Articles/971008/)
What is interesting, is that this is the same git repo that was mentioned in another LWN article's comments (
I would say it's probably just a random co-incidence, but I am not surprised that devs and maintainers are now looking carefully at their own, and other important projects for signs of attack (e.g. the ZSH Plugin Manager video from 8 days ago).
https://lwn.net/Articles/967866/) regarding the actions of a specific user that was (probably innocently) suspected of being involved with the XZ attack, because of their actions (being pushy about updating a version to the vulnerable xz version) in an issue for that repo.
I would say it's probably just a random co-incidence, but I am not surprised that devs and maintainers are now looking carefully at their own, and other important projects for signs of attack (e.g. the ZSH Plugin Manager video from 8 days ago).
